title: 108_hr3860
content: The Act titled "National Trails System Willing Seller Act" authorizes the acquisition of lands from willing sellers for certain trails. The National Trails System Willing Seller Act allows the Federal Government to acquire lands for specific trails with the consent of the owner, limited to one-quarter mile on either side of the trail. The Federal Government can acquire lands for specific trails with the owner's consent, limited to one-quarter mile on either side of the trail for the Continental Divide National Scenic Trail and the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail. The Federal Government can acquire lands for specific trails with the owner's consent, limited to one-quarter mile on either side of the trail for the Iditarod National Historic Trail. The National Trails System Act is amended to require owner consent for acquiring lands outside federally administered areas for specific national scenic trails like the North Country, Ice Age, and Potomac Heritage trails. The National Trails System Act is amended to require owner consent for acquiring lands outside federally administered areas for specific national historic trails like the Nez Perce Trail. The National Trails System Act is amended to authorize appropriations for implementing provisions related to designated trails, with specific funding limits for land acquisition and development of the Natchez Trace National Scenic Trail. Volunteer trail groups are encouraged to participate in trail development.
